transformations.pdf package

transformations.pdf.utils module

transformations.pdf.utils.convert_pdf_to_images(pdf_path: str, start_page: int | None = None, end_page: int | None = None, output_folder: str | None = None) → str[source]

Converts a PDF file to images.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path – The path to the input PDF file.

  • start_page – The starting page number (1-based) to convert. If None, converts all pages.

  • end_page – The ending page number (1-based) to convert. If None, converts all pages.

  • output_folder – The output folder for the images. If None, uses a default name.

Returns:

The path to the output folder containing the images.

transformations.pdf.utils.convert_to_pdf(path: str | List, output_dir: str | None = None, recursive=False) → List[str][source]

Converts a file or directory of files to PDF.

Parameters:

  • path – The file or directory path to convert.

  • output_dir – The output directory for the converted PDF files. If None, uses the same directory as the input files.

  • recursive – If True, recursively convert files in subdirectories.

Returns:

A list of paths to the converted PDF files.

transformations.pdf.utils.draw_bounding_boxes(pdf_path: str, bounding_boxes: List[BoundingBox], destination_path: str | None = None) → str | None[source]

Draws bounding boxes on a PDF file.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path – The path to the input PDF file.

  • bounding_boxes – A list of bounding boxes to draw.

  • destination_path – The output path for the PDF with bounding boxes. If None, uses a default name.

Returns:

The path to the PDF with bounding boxes, or None if no bounding boxes are provided.

transformations.pdf.utils.get_number_of_pages(pdf_path: str) → int | None[source]

Returns the number of pages in a PDF file.

Parameters:

pdf_path – The file path of the PDF file.

Returns:

The number of pages in the PDF file.

transformations.pdf.utils.merge_pdfs(pdf_paths: List, output_path: str | None = None) → str[source]

Merges multiple PDF files into a single PDF file.

Parameters:

  • pdf_paths – A list of paths to the PDF files to merge.

  • output_path – The output path for the merged PDF file. If None, uses a default name.

Returns:

The path to the merged PDF file.

transformations.pdf.utils.rasterize_pdf(pdf_path: str, destination_path: str | None = None)[source]

Rasterizes a PDF file to images.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path – The path to the input PDF file.

  • destination_path – The output path for the rasterized images. If None, uses a default name.

transformations.pdf.utils.tidy_pdf(pdf_path: str, destination_path: str | None = None, deskew: bool = True, auto_crop: bool = True) → str[source]

Tidies a PDF file by deskewing and/or auto-cropping.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path – The path to the input PDF file.

  • destination_path – The output path for the tidied PDF file. If None, uses a default name.

  • deskew – If True, deskews the PDF.

  • auto_crop – If True, auto-crops the PDF.

Returns:

The path to the tidied PDF file.

transformations.pdf.utils.trim_pdf(input_path: str, start_page: int, end_page: int, output_path: str | None = None) → str[source]

Trims a PDF file to the specified start and end pages.

Parameters:

  • input_path – The path to the input PDF file.

  • start_page – The starting page number (1-based).

  • end_page – The ending page number (1-based).

  • output_path – The output path for the trimmed PDF file. If None, uses a default name.

Returns:

The path to the trimmed PDF file.

transformations.pdf.bounding_boxes module

transformations.pdf.bounding_boxes.draw_box_on_pdf(input_pdf_path, output_pdf_path, bounding_boxes: List[BoundingBox], color=(255, 0, 0))[source]

Draws a rectangle on a specified PDF page and saves it as a new PDF.

Parameters:

  • input_pdf_path – (str) Path to the input PDF file.

  • output_pdf_path – (str) Path to save the modified PDF file.

  • bounding_box – (BoundingBox) Page number and Bounding box from the LLM.

  • color – (tuple, optional) RGB color of the rectangle (0-1 range). Defaults to red (1.0, 0, 0).

transformations.pdf.cloud_convert module

transformations.pdf.cloud_convert.convert_directory_to_pdfs(source_dir, dest_dir)[source]

Converts all files in the source directory to PDFs using the CloudConvert API. The resulting PDFs are saved in the destination directory, preserving the directory structure.

Parameters:

  • source_dir – The path to the source directory containing the original files.

  • dest_dir – The path to the destination directory where PDFs will be saved.

transformations.pdf.libre_office module

transformations.pdf.libre_office.convert_file_to_pdf(file_path: str, output_dir: str | None) → str | None[source]

Converts a single file to PDF using LibreOffice.

Parameters:

  • file_path – (str) The path to the file to convert.

  • output_dir – (Optional[str]) The output directory for the converted PDF. If None, uses the same directory as the input file.

Returns:

(Optional[str]) The path to the converted PDF file, or None if the conversion fails.

transformations.pdf.libre_office.convert_folder_to_pdf(dir_path: str, output_dir: str | None = None, recursive: bool = False) → List[str][source]

Converts all supported files in a directory to PDF using LibreOffice.

Parameters:

  • dir_path – (str) The path to the directory containing the files to convert.

  • output_dir – (Optional[str]) The output directory for the converted PDFs. If None, uses the same directory as the input files.

  • recursive – (bool) If True, recursively convert files in subdirectories.

Returns:

(List[str]) A list of paths to the converted PDF files.

transformations.pdf.libre_office.libre_office_convert_file(file_path, output_dir, convert_to='pdf')[source]

Converts a single file to the specified format using LibreOffice.

Parameters:

  • file_path – (str) The path to the file to convert.

  • output_dir – (str) The output directory for the converted file.

  • convert_to – (str) The target format to convert the file to (default is “pdf”).

transformations.pdf.transformations module

class transformations.pdf.transformations.PDFTidy(pdf_path)[source]

Bases: object

A class to tidy up PDF files by converting them to images, deskewing, cropping, and then recompiling them into a PDF.

auto_crop(image: <module 'PIL.Image' from '/Users/cbettis/git/lazarus/impl_utils/.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/PIL/Image.py'>)[source]

Automatically crops the image to remove unnecessary whitespace. :param image: The PIL Image to crop.

deskew(image: <module 'PIL.Image' from '/Users/cbettis/git/lazarus/impl_utils/.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/PIL/Image.py'>)[source]

Deskews the image by correcting its orientation. :param image: The PIL Image to deskew.

rotate(image: ndarray, angle: float, background: int | Tuple[int, int, int]) → ndarray[source]

Rotates the image by the specified angle. :param image: The numpy array representing the image. :param angle: The angle to rotate the image by. :param background: The background color to use for the rotated image. :return: The rotated numpy array image.

tidy(destination_path: str | None = None, deskew: bool = True, auto_crop: bool = True) → str[source]

Tidies the PDF file by converting it to images, optionally deskewing and cropping, and then recompiling them into a PDF. :param destination_path: The destination path for the tidied PDF file. If None, the original filename with “_tidied” appended is used. :param deskew: If True, the images will be deskewed. :param auto_crop: If True, the images will be automatically cropped. :return: The path to the tidied PDF file.

transformations.pdf.transformations.compile_images_to_pdf(image_files: ~typing.List[<module 'PIL.Image' from '/Users/cbettis/git/lazarus/impl_utils/.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/PIL/Image.py'>], destination_path: str)[source]

Compiles a list of images into a PDF file. :param image_files: The list of PIL Image objects to compile. :param destination_path: The destination path for the compiled PDF file. :return: The path to the compiled PDF file.
